roleset.name: to walk at a leisurely pace
roleset.note: STROLL-V NOTES: Member of Vncls run-51.3.2. (from stroll.01-v)
STROLL-N NOTES: Based on verb entry stroll.01; corresponds to Vncls run-51.3.2. (from stroll.01-n)

roles.note: Use ArgMs for destination (gol) and direction. (from stroll.01-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: They 're hiring models [0] [*T*-1]to stroll the aisles [*-2] sporting their jewels , and they 're even beginning to borrow a perennial favorite of the beauty business -- offering a gift when consumers make a purchase .

example.name: intransitive
example.text: While she applauds the fact that [more Americans]-2 are getting up from the television [*-2]to stroll or garden , she says the percentage of Americans who do `` real exercise to build the heart '' is only 10 % to 20 % [*U*] .

example.name: transitive
example.text: You catch the first flight to Macau in the morning , stop at the Westin for a coffee and to talk business , head to one of the outlying islands in the afternoon for a round of golf , take a stroll downtown , and return to Taiwan that evening .

example.name: all arguments
example.text: They waved and said hello as she continued her stroll of the grounds.
